author: Special Correspondent
text:
Workers, under the banner of Jayalalithaa Peravai, taking out a rally in Tiruchi on Wednesday.— PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam went into election mode with the Jayalalithaa Peravai taking out a rally here on Wednesday to highlight the “achievements” of the government led by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

Chief Whip in the State Assembly R. Manoharan flagged off the rally led by J. Srinivasan, secretary of the urban district unit of the Jayalalithaa Peravai, near the Rockfort.

The rallyists distributed pamphlets detailing the “achievements” of the government and sought the support of the people.

M. Paranjothi and S. Valarmathi, MLAs, A. Jaya, Mayor, and other AIADMK office-bearers participated in the rally which went around the city’s main commercial and residential areas such as Chinnakadai Veedhi, East Boulevard Road, and Tharanallur. Khadi and Village Industries Minister T.P. Poonachi inaugurated a similar rally led by rural district secretary of Jayalalithaa Peravai Ramu at Lalgudi. T. Rathinavel, MP, was present.
title: Jayalalithaa Peravai takes out rally
